description.narrative: Because of cuting the number of counterpart and the amount of year 3 budget, FCMN will be the lead of Grow campaign on building resilience of smallholders, pursuing the following objective targeted for this theme by 2017: OS 3 : Leading, the Governmentof Niger and donors to invest more in building the resilience of vulnerable people facing food crises and other natural disasters, by 2017. The expected results by 2017 are: # the government and donors invest more in people's resilience and particularlyin supply food and welfare by providing long-term financing; # people are more resilient to food crises and other natural disasters.

participating-org.narrative: Fédération des Coopératives Maraîch du Niger (FCMN-Niya)

In 1994 eleven horticulture producers# co-operative set up the Association of Market Garden Producers (APROMANI), to counter the lack of attention paid to them by the National Union of Co-operatives and the marketing problems of agriculture products theyencountered. In 1996 APROMANI became the Federation of Market Gardeners of Niger (FCMN). It was registered in 1998. Until 2001 its activitieswere based at its executive office, mainly related to structuring the co-operatives. Since 2001 it has had a cadres specialised in agriculture who provide a sustained technical assistance. From 2001 to 2007 FCMN has worked with three-year strategic plans and annual operational plans. A self-analysis of the organisation has identified gaps in reforms for women#s leadership in the Federation#s co-operatives. It currently has 118 members from all over the country, with a total of 30,000 individual members, of whom 9,000 are women. Since its founding the Federation has initiated structuring activities to strengthen its organisation, including 27 shops forinputs, one pilot centre for marketing fruits and vegetables in Niamey, 120 field workers and six sites for producing onion seeds. It strives to contribute actively to the development of the horticulture sector andfood security in Niger through integrated activities, like the cereal banks supporting schools and health centres, as well as school gardens/ The organisation#s mission is to contribute to improving the living conditions of market garden producers, and tostrengthening their production capacities and the guarantee of proper prices. Its vision is of an autonomous structure of, for and by market gardeners. The institutional objects are (a) to seek solution to the problems in production, the supply of inputsand agricultural materials, product marketing, funding, and trainingof members, and (b) to promote the capacities of the market gardeners# organisations in Niger to become a force for mobilising local resources and advocacy. In order to realise its mission FCMN organises its intervention around the following strategic themes: supply of agricultural inputs, support and advice (training, working out training materials, organisation of producers and capacity building of their organisations), production, marketing, food security, fundraising and management.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

receiver-org.narrative: Fédération des Coopératives Maraîch du Niger (FCMN-Niya)

description.narrative: Improved policies: # of cases where Oxfam/partners influenced governments or global actors in adopting/implementating policies on (i) Sustainable Food production and consumption, (ii) Land Rights and (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
